intro: Spilanthes pusilla, commonly known as the small bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Spilanthes pusilla is typically found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas.
